intro: Anogra, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale purple flowers and its distinctive silver-gray foliage. Anogra produces small, round berries that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. It is often found growing in rocky or dry soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
